resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

wesm commented on issue #3001: ARROW-4262: [Website] Preview to Spark with Arrow and R improvements
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3001#issuecomment-455796786
 
 
   Yes, let's publish next week. I kept planning to review this but I think it's good timing to have a preview of R+Spark to get excited for R becoming generally available in a couple of months. I can review and make any tweaks, and then publish on Monday or Tuesday if that sounds good
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #3001: ARROW-4262: [Website] Preview to Spark with Arrow and R improvements
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3001#issuecomment-455942166
 
 
   @javierluraschi I read through this. Could I ask you to update the benchmarks for the latest version of Arrow before we publish? Also, could you increase the size of the dataset transferred by 10x in the benchmarks? The "with Arrow" cases are in the hundreds of milliseconds generally; since there's a certain amount of overhead net of Arrow, the results with a larger dataset might be more interesting.
   
   @romainfrancois also implemented parallel conversions from Arrow to R in master so that should also improve the performance numbers
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

felixcheung commented on pull request #3001: ARROW-4262: [Website] Preview to Spark with Arrow and R improvements URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3001#discussion_r250883764 ########## File path: site/_posts/2018-11-19-r-spark-improvements.md ########## @@ -182,15 +182,17 @@ Unit: seconds Additional benchmarks and fine-tuning parameters can be found under `sparklyr` -[/rstudio/sparklyr/pull/1611][9]. Looking forward to bringing this feature +[/rstudio/sparklyr/pull/1611][10] and `sparkR` [/apache/spark/pull/22954][11]. Looking forward to bringing this feature to the Spark, Arrow and R communities. fields.summary: [Website] Blog post to give preview into using R and Arrow with Apache Spark
